messages.content: You are an AI assistant that helps people find information. You will receive a task and think step by step. Then provide your final outcome following the regular expression 'Answer: ([A-Za-z ]+,\s*)*[A-Za-z ]+'

Imagine a group with 15 scholars. Amir is connected to Reza, Moin, Pari, and Puja. Wim is connected to Wei, Kim, Puja, and Pam. Raj is connected to Nisha, Ian, Sara, and Kim. Jing is connected to  Reza, Moin, Pari, and Max. Wei is connected to Kim, Puja, and Pam. Nisha is connected to Ian, Sara, and Max. Reza is connected to Moin, and Pari. Kim is connected to Pam. Ian is connected to Sara, and Max. Moin is connected to Pari. Puja is connected to Pam. Sara is connected to Max. You have been told that Kim is donating 50 books and Max is donating 10 books. Now, from Amir what is the shortest path to the person who is donating the maximum number of books? Remember that you can take books only from one person. Starting from Amir, please list the scholar names in order, including Amir, separated by commas.

Answer: ‘Amir, Moin, Puja, Reza, Max’
user: Imagine a group with 15 scholars. Amir is connected to Reza, Moin, Pari, and Puja. Wim is connected to Wei, Kim, Puja, and Pam. Raj is connected to Nisha, Ian, Sara, and Kim. Jing is connected to  Reza, Moin, Pari, and Max. Wei is connected to Kim, Puja, and Pam. Nisha is connected to Ian, Sara, and Max. Reza is connected to Moin, and Pari. Kim is connected to Pam. Ian is connected to Sara, and Max. Moin is connected to Pari. Puja is connected to Pam. Sara is connected to Max. You have been told that Kim is donating 50 books and Max is donating 10 books. Now, from Amir what is the shortest path to the person who is donating the maximum number of books? Remember that you can take books only from one person. Starting from Amir, please list the scholar names in order, including Amir, separated by commas. Answer: ‘Amir, Moin, Wim, Wei, Kim Pari, Nisha, Kim, Jing, Puja and Sara’
user: Imagine a group with 15 scholars. Amir is connected to Reza, Moin, Pari, and Puja. Wim is connected to Wei, Kim, Puja, and Pam. Raj is connected to Nisha, Ian, Sara, and Kim. Jing is connected to Max, Pari, and Sara. Pari is connected to Sara. Sara is connected to Kim and Moin. What is the shortest path to Kim by taking the most books she is donating? Remember that you can take books only from one person.Answer: ‘Amir, Moin, Pari, Puja Kim’
user: Everyone in the class is wearing an RFID. Each RFID is identified with its unique ID number called “Tag Number.” At some point, a teacher wants to know who are wearing pink shirts. In order to do this, he needs a list of all students with their Tag Numbers. The RFID system is not allowed to communicate with an outside

Now you have been told that Amir and Puja had an argument and are no longer connected and instead, Amir is now connected to Sara. Also, Jing is no longer connected to Max and instead, Jing is now connected to Puja. Now, from Amir what is the shortest path to the person who is donating the maximum number of books? Remember that you can take books only from one person. Starting from Amir, please list the scholar names in order, including Amir, separated by commas.

Answer: ‘Amir, Moin, Wei, Pari, Nisha’
user: The professor assigns the students homework. When the professor enters a students number in the computer, It will tell him the homework. The students have a unique number. Each number has been stored in one folder, in which the folder ID is its number. For example the folder with number 120 has the email address of the student. Now, the problem is, the professor wants to see who has done the homework and who hasn't, But he doesn't know the email address of the student. how to do this task?
